TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HotSpotCollection extends System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects inside an control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The HotSpotCollection class represents a collection that enables an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control to maintain a list of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects it contains.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> method to add a specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the collection at the end of an ordinal index array. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the collection at a specified index location. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Item%2A> indexer to directly access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object in the collection at a specified index, using simple array notation.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from the end of the collection. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from a specified index location.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically create an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control and add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to it. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpots%2A> property is used to access the HotSpotCollection collection for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control and add the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to it. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-vb[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_295_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_295_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When overridden in a derived class, this constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot.%23ctor%2A> constructor to programmatically create two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects and add them to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-vb[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_107_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_107_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public int Add (System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot spot);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 Add(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot spot) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to append to the collection.
Docs.summary: Appends a specified object to the end of the collection.
Docs.returns: The index at which the object was added to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Add method adds the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the end of the collection. To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the collection at a specific index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically create an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control and add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to it. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpots%2A> property is used to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control and add the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to it. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-vb[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/52b9e3b0-728a-4dc5-99eb-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[ImageMap.Cstr#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/52b9e3b0-728a-4dc5-99eb-_1.aspx)]

public void Insert (int index, System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot spot);
.method public hidebysig instance void Insert(int32 index, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot spot) cil managed

Docs.param: The array index at which to add the object.
The object to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Inserts a specified object into the collection at the specified index location.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Insert method adds the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the collection at the specified index location. To append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object to the end of the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap.HotSpots%2A> property is used to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> method adds `Circle2` to the collection. The Insert method adds `Circle1` to the collection at the first element, in front of `Circle2`. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-vb[HotSpotCollection.Insert#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ab7caf40-b2de-4bb2-b23a-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[HotSpotCollection.Insert#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ab7caf40-b2de-4bb2-b23a-_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot this[int index] { get; }
.property instance class System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot Item(int32)

Docs.param: The ordinal index value that specifies the location of the object in the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the object at the specified index in the collection.
Docs.value: The object at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this indexer to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object in the collection at the specified index, using array notation. The indexer allows you to modify or replace a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object in the collection directly.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Item property to directly access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection and display the value of each object's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot.AlternateText%2A> property in a label on the page. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-vb[HotSpotCollection.Item#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_688_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[HotSpotCollection.Item#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_688_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void OnValidate (object o);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnValidate(object o) cil managed
public void Remove (System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot spot);
.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot spot) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Remove method removes the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from the collection. To remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from the collection at a specified index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
To add new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. After the two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects are added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection, the Remove method is used to delete `Circle1` from the collection. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-cs[HotSpotCollection.Remove#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f9b25fff-b2da-4484-9775-_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[HotSpotCollection.Remove#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f9b25fff-b2da-4484-9775-_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void RemoveAt (int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The array index from which to remove the object.
Docs.summary: Removes the object at the specified index location from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The RemoveAt method removes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object at the specified index location from the collection. To remove a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> object from the collection by name, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To add new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpot> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Add%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection.Insert%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically add two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageMap> control. After the two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CircleHotSpot> objects are added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HotSpotCollection> collection, the RemoveAt method is used to delete the object located at the first index in the collection. For this example to work correctly, you must supply your own image for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image.ImageUrl%2A> property and update the path to the image appropriately so that the application can locate it.
[!code-vb[HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_136_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[HotSpotCollection.RemoveAt#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_136_1.aspx)]
